sentences.english: Of course, this argument seems a sophistry .
sentences.chinese: 當然，這樣的說法有狡辯之嫌。

sentences.english: The way I justify it is that I am putting together trash to make something new.
sentences.chinese: 我狡辯的方法就是認爲自己是在用廢物製作新的物品。

definition: to refuse to admit (what one has done)/to disavow/to renege
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
